Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2008 08:19AM RN2teach wrote: Hello Gems, We got home last night. Have everything unpacked and half the laundry finished. Was supposed to take ds to a college open house this morning... he didn't get up on his own and I decided he could wait until the August event. The campus is 3 hours away and I needed a break from road trips after the 9 hour trip yesterday! We had a great time relaxing on the beach and enjoying the company of our good friends. We've been friends for 20+ years, but this is the first time we've taken a trip together. I know dh hasn't had so much fun in ages. He and bf's dh are both jokesters and they kept us entertained all week. It was great to see that side of Ed again. I read some of the posts yesterday on my way home and finished up this morning. Looks like everyone is doing well. We definitely are having a puppy boom here, eh? Congrats to Deb and Joan on your new pooches! I'll be back later to try some shout-outs. Gotta go hit the laundry detail. Have a good Monday all! Paula`
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2008 11:03AM RN2teach wrote: Good morning! Still working on cleaning and organizing at home. Amazing how quickly things accumulate, isn't it? Our dishwasher bit the dust Tuesday evening. Boy, was I miffed to have to unload that baby and wash everything by hand! So... as if the $2,000 worth of medical bills that just came in wasn't enough strain on the budget, we added a new dishwasher to the mix. I know it is a luxury, but I replaced it anyway. We're also dealing with a debt collection agency for an $820 medical bill that was never billed to our insurance AND for which we NEVER received a bill prior to it being turned over to the agency. We were first contacted in April and I gave the company my insurance info. Received a second phone call in May verifying insurance info AND another phone call in June checking our insurance information. Got a credit report Monday and learned that this bill is listed. So, I contacted NCO... spent over an hour on the phone, calling 3 different numbers and speaking with 7+ people... none of whom could verify that our insurance had been billed. (I know from my EOBs that no claim has been filed). Did a little research on the company and learned that there is already a $1.5 million judgment against them for violations. Also found out that I should have gotten a written notification of this account prior to any phone contact. So, I filled a complaint with the FTC and fired off a certified letter to NCO requesting the full details of this account. We have always paid our bills and had excellent credit, so this has got me fired up! On a positive note, dh is feeling so good. Thank God! He is doing a few handyman jobs around the house (he loves that kind of thing) and installed the new dishwasher Wednesday. He's even thrown a few compliments my way-something he was faithful about doing all the years of our marriage until the brain tumor 2 years ago. Since then I've had a long dry spell without those warm fuzzies. It is so nice to see the romantic side of him again! So, how are things in the Jewel world? Looks like SISKimberly is off to Tahoe. How nice! Carol- got your message Wednesday. I got a couple of salmon fillets with my king. Thank you again for the treat! YIKES! Burning on the back, eh? Wonder if having the mastectomy is the reason you're experiencing that and the rest of us didn't... I think you're the only Jewel in rads with a pancake. I hope the grease is keeping it under control! So, you should be down to 10 rads to go, right? 2 more weeks and you're finished! So, you're sporting a fresh new hair color! That's got to feel good. I'm still waiting to see what color mine is going to be. I see lots of my original brown, but I'm sure there's lots of silver in there. The longest strands have no color at all, making it difficult to tell the exact color... Julie- getting geared up for school, huh? I have been to my classroom and dropped a few things off, but haven't worked on anything yet. We go to our career and tech ed conference next week and get our new curriculum, so I'll be getting started after that. I go back to work Aug. 14th. I'll probably spend a lot of afternoons at school after conference. I am moving classrooms and I'd like to get that done before I start back to work. I'm the lead health occupations teacher and I'm getting the best classroom-I'll have my own bathroom, a laundry room, and a closet! Yeehaw! WTG getting ds to help you organize your classroom. I plan to get ds and dd to help me move. As an added bonus, dd's boyfriend is something of a computer guru and I'll be taking him along to get my ‘puters cleaned up and ready for school. Hope your dh is feeling better! D1- LOL at the middle toes flipping off the rest! I know it's been a while since the first ones bailed ship. Are they growing back yet? I think I might keep mine. I trimmed them last week and most of the dark is gone. My fingernails are still weak and ugly, but most of the discolored areas have been trimmed away on them, too. Ditto on the shock of looking in the mirror. I haven't worn a topper since mid-June and I forget how bald I look until I see myself. I had one of those compliments on the short ‘do this week. Nice to finally have enough hair that someone might think I intended to have this style! I have to thank you and our other cooks here for inspiring me to get back in the kitchen. I've been totally NOT interested in cooking and have been just doing the basics for months now. I'm ready to have some fun in the kitchen again! Norma- hey, I've noticed the same thing-my legs don't hurt as much. My doc started me on Mirapex for Restless Leg Syndrome back in June and I don't have to take it every night now. Add my son to the video game junkies list. His biggest obsession right now is Guitar Hero, but he also loves to play Halo. I'm feeling a little guilty for letting him spend too much time on the games this summer... I know there are worse things he could be doing, but it just seems like such a waste of time... We are having the same problem with visiting schools-the summer is passing too quickly! Good luck with your college searches. I know my ds will stay in state. He has the grades and ACT scores for our state Promise scholarship, which pays full tuition.   Make sure to let us know when we can order the calendar. I definitely want one! How exciting to know someone who is involved in cancer research. His invention sounds promising! LJ- glad you're enjoying the new DR. LOL-my cats have an affinity for the DR table also. We have an island in our kitchen where we usually eat. It took a good week squirting them with water to train them to stay off the counters. It worked. Wasn't up to the fight for the DR-figured I could wash the table down easily enough! CathyCA- Wow! Sounds like your ds did VERY well, considering he had impacted teeth... We are wireless here, too, and with the push of a button I can turn off the kids' internet access. Comes in very handy during the school months, but I have been letting it go this summer. Maybe I shouldn't have... Hope your Herceptin infusion goes smoothly today. Jenn- I'll be thinking of you today as you have the MRI. Hope that goes well... sharing D1's image of you bouncing around the MRI table... Dana- you're in my thoughts and prayers, too. I'm pleased that the doctor is getting his just rewards for his terrible behavior. I'm also relieved that you won't have to be involved in the criminal case-you have enough irons in the fire right now! If they don't need your testimony to convict him, so be it. You will be able to concentrate on school and your health. It seems to me that your chances of winning your civil case would increase with his criminal conviction. Could you hold off on the civil suit until after you graduate? It would surely be a lot less stressful for you. A cruise?! What a fabulous graduation gift! Kathy- so sorry that you've got a bug, but good to know there's an explanation for the symptoms you had earlier this week. I know you're looking forward to being off this weekend. Rest well and feel better soon! I teach CPR to my students, so did the AHA and ARC classes to certify as an instructor. It is one of my favorite things to teach in the classroom. Sherry- my friend, you have nothing to feel guilty about. The great thing about the Jewels is that each of us has our own life to live, even though we are connected by BC. I get so much joy reading about what everyone is doing. By reading about the ways that our Gems enrich their lives, I find new ways to add joy to mine. I'm getting so much pleasure sharing the wedding plans and anticipation with you. Thank you! Oh my! Look at the time... gotta run-I have a lunch date with some friends... See ya, Paula
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Oct 11, 2008 10:53PM - edited Oct 11, 2008 10:57PM by RN2teach Looks like I'm the only Jewel at home this weekend... hope you all are doing something fun! I've been here at the 'puter most of the day. Just finished getting the sub lesson plans in order for next week. Also got the laundry caught up (whew!) and ran out to restock the pantry. Wasn't the most exciting Saturday, but I'm feeling quite satisfied at the moment, knowing I'm ready for next week. I did take time to enjoy a beautiful fall day. I live "up a holler" with hills surrounding my house. This morning I sat on the deck, basking in the autumn sun and admiring the trees in their autumn finery, backlit by a perfect azure sky.... beautiful! I thought of you all then and wished you were here to see it. Kimberly and Kathleen, I sent positive vibes your way this morning as I communed with nature. You're both in my thoughts and prayers. Thought of Patty and her sister, so I sent up a prayer for them as well. And for Jenn-- hope the sun is shining on your world! Deb1023- thanks for checking in. I knew you were probably just busy with life (as it should be!), but it is always good to hear from you! Love your pup icon! CHJ- hey there, Carol! Glad to see you're doing well. LOL at the friggin' BC awareness comment. I guess all the pinkness of October does bring back all the painful memories of the BC journey... Three cheers to being a survivor! Julie- so the consult won't happen until late Oct., which means no endoscopy until November? How are things in that area? Any further symptoms? Carla- got your PM. Will let you know when we get the visit scheduled. Were supposed to go up this Monday, but I had to cancel as I'm getting my port out. D1- Hope you're having a good weekend with the girls! Have a great weekend, Jewels, Paula
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2008 01:05AM RN2teach wrote: Evening Jewels, Whew! I have a lot to catch up on... Dana- oh dear, Lil Warrior! I'm so very sorry to read about your dad's illness and death. You're a true SHERO, girl- caring for your dad, battling cancer AND graduating from nursing school. You should be back from your cruise soon. I know it must be a bittersweet experience since this was a gift from your dad. I hope that you come back rejuvenated and ready to pass those boards. You're in my prayers. Carla- happy belated birthday, WVGirl! I'm glad your girls were good to you- nothing like a clean kitchen, eh? Also good to see that you are planning for a better future for yourself. You deserve better than a life with an abusive husband and your girls will come around. We're all rooting for you! Kathy- hope the birthday party went well today. Pink eye and flu bugs... ah, the joys of motherhood! Hope your good handwashing helps you dodge the bullet and stay healthy! God knows you don't have TIME to be sick... Hope your doggie is feeling better- poor baby! LJ- thanks for the weight training and Project Gutenberg links. I haven't gotten into audio books yet, but I love to read, so maybe it's time to give it a try. What kind of MP3 did you end up getting? Carol- thanks again for the birthday surprise! Sorry to hear that you're having a bit of pain from the port removal. Hopefully, it will be short-lived. Baby Katie is precious- what a great picture of the two of you! Sorry to hear Zach had another "wild hair" while you were out of town. Teenagers can be such a PITA sometimes... I had a bit of a disagreement with dd's bf today. He is more of a drama queen (king?) than my dd, so he blew it waaayyy out of proportion. As if having a high maintenance dd wasn't enough... SIGH D1- I don't know what a Yellow Bird is either, but judging from your smiles it musta been good! I can see the family resemblance- esp. in the smiles, like Carol mentioned. What a treat to revisit the site of such sweet memories! How trying that your college girl's new beau is a dud... my dd is only 15 and in her first "relationship" (as the Myspace generation calls it). I'm growing to dislike this boy more and more... he's moody and has been verbally abusive to her on several occasions. It infuriates me! Esp. when I hear her begging and crying... ARGH! I've tried to talk to her, but you can guess how that goes. I'm the enemy. Ah, well... CHJ- So, did the colonoscopy results come back okay? Therese- Congrats on getting your gals all dressed up with the tats! LOL at the "hair tease away" analogy- IKWYM, my hair is so... POOFY. I'm due for a trim. Until a couple of years ago, I wore my hair nearly as short as it is now, but it was so straight. Never thought I'd look forward to getting rid of my curls, but I am! Sherry- haven't heard from you since you mentioned getting the biopsy results from your gastroscopy. Hope everything is A-OK and you're just too busy to post. I'm praying for a smooth transition to just ONE manageable job for you in the near future! PALady- as if one ovarian cyst wasn't enough... How'd the US go this week? Hope you got good results. With your BC history (not finding your lump on mammo) and your young age, I can't believe your doc wouldn't consider an MRI... It seems that the standard of care is just the annual mammo, though- that's what my oncologist recommends (and the blood work for tumor markers). I'm thankful to have a surgeon with an aggressive follow-up mindset. He did agree that the false positives can "have us chasing our tails," but believes it is still worth it. Don't be afraid to keep asking for that MRI if you feel that strongly about it. Deb- I hear you on the port removal! Why do you have to wait until January? Kimberly- thanks so much for the birthday card- yours was the first that I received this year! I see your port removal is coming up soon and Kathleen's surgery as well. You'll be in my thoughts. BTW, loved your school's mock election- what a great lesson for your students! Julie- I got my very own birthday animation on the Jewel thread- I've finally made it! LOL  I'd say you've made a sound decision with the remodeling vs. selling, given the economic situation. Happy decorating! Cathy- guess you're gearing up for your last training walk before the big event next weekend. Have fun! I'm glad you've got a cautious surgeon- wish all of the Jewels did... Sorry to hear about your MIL's cancer diagnosis. Not easy to have to relive those experiences, is it? Sorry this is so long- I get a little chatty when I'm catching up with my Jewel pals! Things are going "ok" here. Dh and I had quiet birthdays- no celebrations as he isn't feeling well. He is sleeping most of the time still and now having headaches. Trying not to read a lot into it as I know the meds can cause some brain swelling, but still... he's having difficulty carrying on a conversation and can't understand me half the time... MRI is scheduled for next Friday, then back to Duke... I'd better get moving toward the bed. I've sat here for so long that I'm going to be doing my 80-year-old shuffle when I get up. Have a good Sunday!
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Nov 26, 2008 08:43AM - edited Nov 26, 2008 08:44AM by RN2teach Just a quick note, ds and I have dermatologist appts this morning. Got in from Duke last night around 10pm. Ed's MRI showed a new tumor and lots of brain swelling, which explains all the symptoms we've been seeing. So, we'll be traveling back to NC on Sunday (right in the middle of Thanksgiving travelers). He starts a new clinical trial on Monday. We'll be at Duke all day Monday, return Tuesday morning for blood work, and then we'll travel back home. This is a good trial for him, I think. Two oral chemos--Temodar (the standard for glioblastoma) and the experimental drug Topotecan, which is approved for ovarian cancer. Have to read up on that one still... Julie- I can hear you "sloshing" from here with all that liquid. I'll be thinking of you as you take the plung today... literally! OK, gotta run. I'll be back later...
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2009 11:11PM RN2teach wrote: Hey Jewels, My old Gateway limped into the new year and coughed up its last pixel on New Year's Day. So, I'm sharing ds's laptop until my new Mac arrives. I've always had a desktop, but decided to go for a laptop this time. They are so handy. The first day back at school went well, although I confess I am pooped this evening! My time off sure went by quickly. I'm a bit anxious about leaving dh at home alone. He's still quite confused at times... wanders around in a daze. He's just finished with round 2 of his chemo, so hoping he gets back to normal soon. In the meantime, I've arranged for his two retired brothers who live nearby to check in on him and I'll be coming home for lunch. One day at a time... So, happy 2009! Our NY eve was quiet, but nice. I enjoyed your fireworks, Kimberly. What a view! Hey Sherry- glad to see you're feeling better. What a way to ring in the new year with an ear ache and UTI- double trouble for sure! I see you've had a glitch with the work-at-home job. Hang in there. After what you've survived in the past year, this is small stuff. ((Hugs)) Carol- your phone call was the highlight of my Saturday. Thanks for the chat! I forgot to ask about Zach, but I see he started PT today. Donna- warm weather, a beach and a beautiful sunset.... What a beautiful way to usher out the old year and welcome 2009! I'll be watching for the pics when you get home. You're in my prayers as your doctor's visit come up Friday. Got my fingers crossed for good news. D1- you dropped the F-bomb (my kids' lingo) so many times in that NY Eve post that my granny woulda been after you with a bar of soap! Made me chuckle! Watched part of the Vikings game Sunday  and I said a WTF in your honor. So, hope dd's finger is feeling better.  You have every right to get soapboxy about Tamox. You've been a trooper taking that stuff with the SE's that you're experiencing. Somethin's gotta give... Ah, there's an update on your BIL. Sounds like he's doing well! Kathy- oh, my! Sorry to read about your illness and hospitalization before Christmas. Glad you made it through the holidays and the MRI... and reading on- good news from the MRI! Hallelujah! And the alien implant comes out Friday, I see. I hope you removal goes easy- you'll be glad to be rid of that sucker, I think! Patty- good to see your post! Bummer about the celiac disease- a definite PITA, huh? Good luck on adjusting your diet to stay healthy. Glad to see vettesis is doing well and a big HOWDY to Vetteguy! Kris- Dang! Hope things settle down with the drainage. What's the doc say about all this? I see D1 had a similar experience with her lumpectomy... makes me cringe just thinking about it... Kimberly- thanks for the letter. I was pleased to get a hard copy of your NY poem. I shared it with my work family today and they loved it!   Tina- awwww, Snowy Joey is adorable!  I couldn't get the link to work, but I did find your house on Zillow. It looks great.  Pink skis and poles, huh? That's a new one. You'll have to get a pink ski ensemble and post a pic! Carla- tennis elbow... yikes! Hope the steroid shots helped. Julie- so, the girls are looking good, eh? I had to chuckle at Kathy's comment about using labial tissue to construct new nipples... lips for nips? Makes me shudder just to think of it! Glad things worked out with the new vehicle and you got one you liked even better than the first one. All's well that ends well! CHJ- I watched the Ravens make toast outta Miami yesterday. They're playing well.  I'm not a Dolphins fan, but we follow them b/c their QB, Chad Pennington has a WV connection- his wife is from our town. Better post this and go get ready for tomorrow. Still have to iron my uniform... I'll be dressing in scrubs a lot over the next few months as I take the kids out to the hospital for clinical training. We're working in the lab right now and will start in the hospital in February. Take care all! Paula
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2009 08:16PM RN2teach wrote: Just back from the onc. We actually got in and out quicker than usual, but stopped for dinner on the way home. There's a little snow mixed in with the rain and the river near our home is up. Our little holler may be blocked by high water at some point if this rain continues-- usually happens at least once a year. Anybody got a boat I can borrow?! Anyway, my armpit lump is just a firm lymph node (it's actually not as firm as it was last month when I first noticed it). Had my blood drawn for tumor markers and should get those results tomorrow. I do have a weird knot-thing on my cervical spine (neck) that we've decided to scan. Don't think it is anything... feels spongy (kinda like cartilage)... I noticed it a couple of years ago and it hasn't changed/ doesn't cause me any discomfort.  As for dh, everyone noticed the change in him since his last visit in Sept. He normally is chatty and joking around... he didn't acknowledge any of them today. The onc. upped his decadron and ordered an MRI. We should be getting that in the next couple of days. Hopefully this regression will be r/t brain swelling and not tumor growth. If it is caused by swelling, the higher dose of decadron should really help that.  Carol- well, I'm glad I warned you to be extra cautious today... you never know! CHJ- I HATE to vacuum anyway-- don't think having a pink vacuum would help any! Vettegal- sorry you and your sister are having problems. ((Hugs))  D1-  no one can say that you aren't giving Tamox a fair chance. Sorry it's taking a toll on your mood. I cannot imagine you hissing... but wait a minute... you DID have a wild look in your eyes in our thug pics.... hmmmm We can share the loony suite only if I get my own bed.  Back to the laundry... Paula
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2009 07:04PM RN2teach wrote: We're back from the MRI. We were sitting in Bennigan's grabbing a bite when the onc. called only 2 hours after the MRI was completed... wasn't expecting that, and my heart sank. Dh has several new tumors and increased swelling. I'll be on the phone with Duke first thing Monday morning to come up with a new game plan, then report back to our onc. here. He wasn't very pleased with this new trial that dh is on and has some alternatives for us, if Duke isn't ready to act quickly. I haven't looked at the MRI CD yet... will wait until dh goes to bed-- I'm a little too close to tears to look at it with him sitting here in the same room. FUBC (brain cancer, breast cancer-- it all sucks!)
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2009 03:33PM - edited Jan 11, 2009 03:38PM by RN2teach First off, I want to thank you all for your support. I cannot express how much you all mean to me… women I’ve never seen face-to-face, and yet you are all my sisters.Thank you for “listening” and I’ll ask forgiveness in advance for this long post. It seems to help to pour my heart out here. There’s no improvement at all from dh's increased steroids. Guess the tumors must be affecting the speech center. He seems to understand, just can’t communicate well. He’s always been pretty easy-going and, thankfully, he’s staying in character. He’ll try to say something and then just shake his head after awhile and say “never mind.” Most of the time I’m able to guess what he’s trying to say.The perks of a 26-year relationship, I suppose.  Most of his deficits are mental. Physically he can still take care of himself for the most part—getting dressed, hygiene, etc. The right side of his mouth draws down and he has slight weakness on the right side (kinda like a stroke patient). His voice is weak, but no swallowing problems. I’ve got a lot of experience working with stroke and head injury patients, so my training will be of benefit in taking care of him. I’m making arrangements for regular check-ins by family/neighbors. I hope that’s enough… it is so hard to judge. I don’t want anything to happen to him and having a history of seizures means he’s at high risk with the tumors growing…. On the other hand, he’s able to take care of himself so well that having a presence here throughout the day may upset him… FUBC!!! I want him to be safe, but also want him to be happy. His sister is coming in from Ohio Tuesday, so I’ll have a couple of anxiety-free days this week as far as dh is concerned. Ds is working, dd out with her bf at his parents’ home. I’ve got some papers to grade, bills to pay, laundry to do, etc. BUT, I had to take care of the important stuff first—checking in my Jewel gals! Carol- I spent yesterday working with my music, too. My iPod had to be reformatted to work on my Mac, which means all the music got wiped out. It was all on CDs anyway, so I spent the afternoon uploading all my music to iTunes and then syncing my iPod again. I quit after the 40th CD. I’ve got 2GB uploaded and have room on my iPod for 2 more. Therese- another 3-Dayer. Congrats on getting involved. I sent Carol a couple of books about preparing for the 3-Day last summer.“Foot Soldiers: Stories from the Breast Cancer 3-Day Walk” and “The Complete Guide to Marathon Walking.” I’m not sure which one she recommends, but I know at least one of them was pretty helpful. You can get them both on Amazon. Norma- FUBC again! I’m bummed that Toni is going through treatment again. She’s really been hammered with this beast. Please let her know she’s in my thoughts and prayers. Dale will do his senior project next semester, which begins in a couple of weeks. Ours is a combo portfolio/scrapbook—very similar to what you described. They have to reflect back on the stages of their life thus far, include pics, and also complete a cover letter & resume, document community service, articulate a 5-year plan for reaching career goals, etc. It includes an interview. The judging committee is made up of English teachers and business professionals from the community, who volunteer to help. It takes place over several days (each student gets an appointment, like a job interview). So, although it will be a wonderful experience, there’s a butt-load of work involved! I envy you that your ds’s is completed already! There’s going to be a lot going on this spring—scholarship deadlines, conferences, prom, graduation plans… Lord, give me strength! So glad your onc. is taking you off of Tamox permanently. I’ll be thinking of you this week as you see your docs and make those decisions about treatment and surgery. Patty- so, you’ll schedule your surgery this week. With Aunt Flo dropping in unannounced (inconsiderate bitch!), I know you’ll be looking forward to getting rid ofthose organs. LOL at snapfish… they come up with some interesting names for these photo websites, don’t they? Ditto what the other Jewels said about taking care of yourself emotionally. You’ve been through a lot, gf! Oh yeah, GO STEELERS! Lots of Steeler fans in this neck of the woods. Kimberly- (passing you a tissue and some Tylenol) sorry you’re sick again. Hope you’re on the mend.  I am so happy that you liked the twin heart weaving, and touched that you’re displaying it with a treasured photo of you and ds! You put me to shame with your exercise routine. I’m hitting the treadmill haphazardly, doing a few yoga stretches… that’s it. Need to do better, just don’t have the energy or the motivation. You, my dear, are a WONDERFUL teacher! I know you’re having a positive impact on your students, even though you’ll have to wait years before you ever hear from them about it. I got visits from 3 of my former students during their Christmas break from college. Two of them are 2nd year nursing students, the other is 3rd year pre-med. They all gave me warm fuzzies about how much my program has helped them in college. I’ve got those comments logged in my memory bank to dredge up when I feel that my efforts in the classroom are futile! I know you’ve mentioned similar visits from former students—keep those memories nearby when you’re frustrated. Good advice to Sherry. Hmmm, your dream interpretation seems to be right on the money! About that size 4 prom dress… it belongs to my niece. Rach brought it home for me to see recently… it is way to revealing for Mama—dd has some nice-sized jugs and they’re spilling out of it. So, this is a source of conflict here.SIGH! Carla- remind me again about your new tattoo—was it a butterfly? Where’d you get tattooed? LOL at the weather- grocery angle. Same thing happens here when weather warnings head our way. Ds works at the local grocery store and has complained about how busy it gets when bad weather is headed our way. Happy early Bday to the twins. How cool that you’ve kept in touch with your hospital roomie from 20 years ago. LJ- you’re right there again with good research to share. What would we do without you?! Glad you’re a Jewel! Kathy- sounds like you’re doing well about the de-porting (haha).  Hope ds gets that bike (sounds like a win-win situation to me!) LOL at dh’s birthday present. That has always been my dh’s favorite “gift.” I can relate to where you’re at right now with small children and a busy work life—except you’re also a BC survivor on top of all that… I'm actually grieving for the loss of that aspect of my relationship with dh. My libido was never up to par with dh's, but we had a good sex life until this fall. He hasn't initiated anything since Oct. and I won't make the first move-- it would be devastating to him if he couldn't perform. (Sorry, TMI!)  D1- WELL SAID! Tina- hope the house showings go well today. I don’t envy you in having to keep the house ship-shape all the time. I imagine it helps that your boys are out of the house. Our house looks pretty good with the exception of the kids’ rooms. CHJ- Go Ravens!! I’m all over the Jewels FUBC Reunion Tour (how apt, Vettegal!). Hopefully, my life will cooperate and allow me to participate.   Sorry again for the length. If you’re still here at this point, you deserve a medal for making it thru this post! Paula
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2009 02:59PM - edited Feb 3, 2009 08:10PM by RN2teach School was cancelled yesterday and today d/t the weather—worked out well for me as far as having to take sick days!  I won’t complain about our 2 degree temps here after reading that it’s -6 in PA…. and I know that my Jewel friends in the north are used to this stuff. I’ve only experienced one winter of living in a sub-zero climate. I don’t think I was ever warm the winter that I lived in Finland! It’s prob. -10 or lower there now… We came home right after Ed finished his chemo. Had good traveling weather—sunny skies until we hit WV. Ran into some snow, but it was just starting so no worries. I’m glad we came home last night. Dh is feeling yucky today. (We all remember how that feels, right?) This is his first foray into IV chemo. I’ve worked out a plan with a dear neighbor for the short-term. We’re going to try hourly checks on dh, since he’s physically able to care for himself and spends the greatest part of his day resting in the recliner watching the tube… If that isn’t enough, I’ve got some contacts for a full-time caregiver. Now, to catch up on the Jewels… LJ- I spoke too soon, huh? I’m glad you’re almost finished.  After I read your post I looked back at our treatment list. Quite of few Herceptin gals in our group… you, Cathy, Kathy, Jenn, and JackieB (haven’t heard from Jenn or Jackie in forever—anyone know how they’re doing?).  Are you coming to Vegas? I’d love to be able to put a face with that hand! D1- some mysterious spotting, huh? How many SE’s can one woman have? ((Hugs)) I’ve never seen Bette Midler, but love her feisty attitude. I could use a dose of The Divine Miss M right now… Patty- hope you’ve got your layers on today— brrrrr! Sounds like you’re the Vegas expert here. I love reading about your adventures there. CHJ- I love the banter between you and Patty on your football teams. I’m not a big football fan, but watch with dh. If I had to pick a team, it would be the Browns and they’ve not had a good year in decades(?).  Lots of Steelers fans in this area… Kimberly- hoping that you’ve regained your voice by now. Sounds like you could have used a couple of snow days… Kathy- how nice of your co-workers to recognize all that you’ve gone through and throw you a party! LOL at your dh’s libido remarks. I’m a little nostalgic for those days right now, but I recall when they were annoying— like in the middle of cooking dinner, at 5am (not a morning person, but dh is), etc. Retinal hemorrhages? What the @#$ is up with that? Oh, bother! Sherry- good news on the raise. Hope the training goes smoothly. Julie- hope you ended up with a snow day today, but since you haven’t posted yet, I assume not. TGIF! Cathy- great job, throwing out some good ideas for the Jewels reunion! OK… guess I have to end this post. The laptop is “annoying” dh. Sheesh! I sympathize on the one hand, but on the other hand I’m thinking WTF? I’m sitting in the family room where dh watched tv non-stop through my chemo… if it bothered me, I just shuffled off to bed… humph! Later, Paula
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2009 06:05PM RN2teach wrote: Well, hey there, Kathleen!  I thought the same thing as SIS Kimberly (that you'd posted in the wrong place). I don't think I've seen you on this thread before, so didn't even think that you might be talking about our Vegas soiree. Anyhoo, the more the merrier! If you're interested in joining us, perhaps we can get acquainted? Tell us a bit about yourself-- I checked out your profile and see that you've done a mast and chemo, and still in rads, but past the halfway mark.   We are still very much in the early planning phase of our trip. Just watch the thread and you'll get all the scoop as it happens! Look forward to hearing all about you... Paula
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2009 10:10PM RN2teach wrote: Thank you to my SP for the goodie boxes filled with yummy treats. It actually arrived yesterday, but dh had put it in the dining room and I didn't notice the box until last night. All of the boxes were decorated with smiley faces-- it was the perfect pick-me-up! I'm trying to be nice and share with my family, but I'm tempted to hide those JellyBellys... dd has her sticky fingers in the jelly beans right now! We had snow and ice and school was cancelled today. Dale and I worked on scholarship apps for a while, did some laundry, read a little, and wrote a 50 item test for one of my classes.  We already have a 2-hour delay for tomorrow-- it is sleeting outside right now and the roads are a mess. Wouldn't be surprised if school is cancelled altogether again... we are under a flood watch again and more snow/sleet is expected thru the night.   I've spent quite a bit of time on Facebook uploading pictures, which is surprisingly simple. I've got over 100 pics up and it didn't take long at all to accomplish.  Sherry- I think that whole poking thing on FB is overrated, don't you? LOL  Even though I've embraced the whole FB thing, I can understand that moving our LV discussion there might be prohibitive (is that a word?) to some of our group. Although, like Kimberly, I like the idea of continuing our friendships in a non-cancer-related venue.  D1, could we post the trip details in your header (or whatever you call your post at the top)? That way it would be on every page. I don't suppose anyone has gotten sentimental about seeing all of our treatment info, have they?! That would keep those who don't want to get into Facebook "in the know"... whaddaya think, Jewels? Kimberly- I have the same problems with some of the kids in my classes. Sometimes it takes that phone call home to get them back on track... sadly, that doesn't even work for a few. It is frustrating-- seems as if I spend a lot of time trying to motivate kids who don't want to be motivated...  Just read about your good results-- except for the one parent with the 'tude... there's one in every bunch!  Julie- glad you made it home safely! Looks like you're going to get hit by this latest storm coming through... Deb and Therese- you're both in the middle of the bad weather, too. Stay safe out there! Carol- I think we might need another pair of BGP... these are getting a little threadbare from all the use they're getting these days! I thought about you today out there in the cold weather. Hope you're home relaxing by the fire this evening.  Okay, I took the JellyBellys away from dd and now I'm going to have to go put them up before I eat them all... later! Paula
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2009 07:40PM RN2teach wrote: Another busy Saturday here. Laundry is still in progress and I just finished w/ my taxes! We'll end up getting a nice return from both fed and state, thanks in part to the medical expenses. This is the first year I've ever been able to claim medical bills-- we had $10,000 in out-of-pocket expenses... OUCH! I knew it was a lot... I got ds' FAFSA (financial aid form) and the kids' taxes filed today as well, so I'm rewarding myself with the rest of the day off!  Dh is doing okay. Feeling crummy, sleeping a lot, but n/v are controlled (thank you, Zofran!).  Kris- I didn't realize you had a son old enough to drive. LOL at his text message. Bet you were glad when he got home!  Sorry about your computer woes. Hope you get it "thawed out" soon! D1- you are definitely the SE queen of the Jewels. I just hate that! You've got a real catch-22 with the tamox and antidepressants... hope you can get the right combo worked out so that you'll feel like yourself again... SOON! ((HUG)) Carol- you're sooo thoughtful! What a great gift for your ex to have a pic of Zach. Joan- see you on FB! Maz- I'm bummed to see that you're going to have surgical biopsies this week. You're in my prayers! I'll be looking for you on FB-- I'm heading there next! Julie- did you get the sectional sold? I loved your narrative about moving that sucker from the basement to the garage. What ingenuity! Kimberly- love it that you have a good boss-- makes ALL the difference when there's a problem! LOL at the brown nose + choc. cake! Didn't even catch that... Off to tackle another load of laundry and check in at FB! Paula
